bugs.title: CVE-2021-26926 jasper: Out of bounds read in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-26926 jasper: Out of bounds read in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-26926 jasper: Out of bounds read in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in jasper. An out of bounds read issue was found in jp2_decode function whic may lead to disclosure of information or program crash.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/264

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/commit/41f214b121b837fa30d9ca5f2430212110f5cd9b

Public now via upstream bug report:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/264

Created jasper tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1922320]


Created mingw-jasper tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1922319]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4235 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4235

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-26926

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable

# Suggest that users restart after update

bugs.title: CVE-2021-26927 jasper: NULL pointer dereference in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-26927 jasper: NULL pointer dereference in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-26927 jasper: NULL pointer dereference in jp2_decode() in jp2_dec.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in jasper. A null pointer dereference in jp2_decode in jp2_dec.c may lead to program crash and denial of service.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/265

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/commit/41f214b121b837fa30d9ca5f2430212110f5cd9b

Public now via upstream bug report:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/265

Created jasper tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1922494]


Created mingw-jasper tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1922493]

Note that the fist Jasper version that crashes with the reproducer included in the upstream bug report is 2.0.20.  However, the problem exists in earlier versions as well.  More detailed analysis can be found in the upstream issue:

https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/269#issuecomment-804423097

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4235 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4235

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-26927
